result.execSummary:
The defendant Gary W. Schmitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Counseling as recommended by agent. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary W. Schmitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called: 2:21 pm
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence:
Defendant appears in person pro se;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. 
  
PLEA: Ct. 1 (4th Degree Sexual Assault)>>NO CONTEST.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: Sentence W/H- 1 Year Probation. CONDITIONS: Counseling as recommended by agent, No Contact with L.J.B., Court Costs.

Adjourned: 2:27 pm
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Pre-trial conference at 07-28-2015 02:10 pm.
Final pre-trial at 08-19-2015 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial at 09-30-2015 09:00 am.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept. No contact with victim(s): L.B. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
